p: The ability to scavenge the 1,1-diphenyl-2-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) radical was calculated using the following Formula (2) as described by Chakraborty and Paulraj [ 44]: DPPH scavenging activity (%) = (A 0 − A 1)/A 0 × 100, (2) where A 0 is the absorbance of the control and A1 is the absorbance of the sample. The antioxidant activity was expressed as IC 50 (mg/mL), which represented the extract concentrations scavenging 50% of DPPH radicals [ 45].
